snippet: A survey shows a notable increase of electronic cigarettes in middle school and high school, making a strong case for regulation.
abstract: Editorial contends Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report that found notable increase in use of electronic cigarettes by high school and middle school students makes case for stronger regulation of such devices; points out nicotine delivered in any manner can impair adolescent brain development, so sales and marketing of such devices to those under 18 should be banned.
lead_paragraph: A survey shows a notable increase of electronic cigarettes in middle school and high school, making a strong case for regulation.
